newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Wednesday's Commission briefing.
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Wednesday's Commission briefing.

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Wednesday:

Spokesman Thierry Daman said Internal Market Commissioner Mario Monti would possibly give a news conference at 1700/1600 GMT depending on the result of the Commission's discussion on the taxation of energy products and the draft media concentration directive at its weekly meeting in Strasbourg.
He said that on Thursday at 1215 (1115) there would be a technical briefing on a document from Social Affairs Commissioner Padraig Flynn on improving social.
The Commission released the following documents:
- IP/97/210: Commission approves acquisition of Creditanstalt by Bank Austria after undertakings.
- Speech/97/59: speech by Commission President Jacques Santer at the European Parliament on the occasion of the formal sitting of the 40th anniversary of the Treaty of Rome.
- IP/97/209: Intermediate ministerial meeting on the integration of fisheries and environmental issues (IMM) - Bergen in Sweden on March 13 and 14.
